author: TBNeditor3
title: How To Utilize Unused Land for Solar Power
text:
Are you sitting on a plot of unused land, scratching your head, wondering what to do with it? Well, why not turn that idle space into a solar power haven? Utilizing unused land for solar power is not only beneficial for the environment but can also be a profitable venture.
Why Choose Solar Power for Unused Land? Letâ€™s start with the obviousâ€”solar power is green. By installing solar panels, you reduce your carbon footprint and contribute to a cleaner planet.
Solar energy produces no emissions, and itâ€™s a renewable resource, unlike fossil fuels, which are rapidly depleting.
Financial Incentives Did you know that going solar can save you money in the long run? Many governments offer incentives and tax breaks for solar panel installations. Plus, any excess electricity generated can be sold back to the grid, providing you with a steady income stream.
Increased Property Value Believe it or not, adding solar panels to your unused land can increase your propertyâ€™s value. Future buyers will see it as an asset, knowing they can save on electricity costs and contribute to environmental conservation.
If you need help installing solar panels, this solar panel installation company might help â€” visit their website .
Assessing Your Land for Solar Potential The first step in your solar power venture is to assess how much sunlight your land receives. Ideally, the location should get at least six hours of direct sunlight per day. Use tools like solar pathfinders or consult a professional to determine the best spot for your solar panels.
Land Size and Shape Solar panels require a considerable amount of space. Make sure your land is large enough to accommodate them. Even oddly shaped plots can work, but you might need a customized layout to maximize efficiency.
Zoning Laws and Regulations Before you go ahead with your solar power project, check local zoning laws and regulations. Some areas have restrictions on solar panel installations, and you might need special permits. Better safe than sorry, right?
Choosing the Right Solar Panels There are three main types of solar panels:
Monocrystalline â€“ Efficient but expensive. Polycrystalline â€“ Cost-effective but less efficient. Thin-Film â€“ Flexible and lightweight but lower efficiency. Each type has its pros and cons, so choose one that best suits your needs and budget.
Installation Process You can either hire a professional installer or go the DIY route. While DIY might save you some money, professional installation ensures the job is done correctly and safely. Plus, professionals can handle the necessary permits and inspections.
Preparing the Site Before installation, clear the land of any obstacles like trees or debris. Level the ground if needed, and mark out where the panels will go. This might sound tedious, but trust us, itâ€™s worth it.
Connecting to the Grid Once the panels are installed, they need to be connected to the electrical grid. This involves wiring, inverters, and sometimes batteries for storage. Again, itâ€™s best to leave this to the professionals to avoid any electrical mishaps.
Making the Most of Your Solar Energy Net metering allows you to sell excess electricity back to the grid, often at retail rates. This can offset your electricity bills and even generate extra income. Check if your area offers net metering and how to apply.
Battery Storage Consider adding battery storage to your solar system. This allows you to store excess electricity for use during cloudy days or at night, ensuring a constant power supply.
Community Solar Projects If your land is large enough, consider creating a community solar project. This allows multiple households to benefit from your solar system, sharing the costs and benefits. Itâ€™s a great way to foster community spirit while promoting renewable energy.
Transforming your unused land into a solar power haven is a win-win situation. Youâ€™re not only contributing to a greener planet but also reaping financial benefits. With the right planning, equipment, and maintenance, your solar project can be a shining example of sustainability and innovation.
TIME BUSINESS NEWS

author: RedacciÃ³n Mundo
title: La ACNUR alerta de la situaciÃ³n de migrantes venezolanos en Brasil por las lluvias | EL ESPECTADOR
text: Las inundaciones causadas por los temporales que azotan esta semana Brasil, especialmente Rio Grande do Sul, afectaron al menos a 41.000 refugiados en ese estado meridional del paÃ­s, muchos de ellos procedentes de Venezuela y HaitÃ­, advirtiÃ³ este viernes la Agencia de la ONU para los Refugiados (ACNUR). â€œMuchos venezolanos y haitianos viven en zonas afectadas a las cuales sÃ³lo se puede llegar en barcoâ€, asegurÃ³ el portavoz de ACNUR, William Spindler, en rueda de prensa a los medios acreditados ante la ONU en Ginebra. MÃ¡s del 85 % del territorio de este estado se ha visto afectado por las inundaciones, unas 68.000 personas se han visto obligadas a vivir en refugios adaptados y mÃ¡s 327.000 han tenido que abandonar sus casas. A nivel nacional, las inundaciones masivas han dejado al menos 107 muertos y 134 desaparecidos, mientras que los afectados superan ya los 1,7 millones. Ante esta situaciÃ³n, ACNUR, en coordinaciÃ³n con las autoridades locales, estÃ¡ proporcionando a la poblaciÃ³n afectada ayuda humanitaria asÃ­ como apoyo tÃ©cnico para facilitar que los refugiados tengan acceso a la informaciÃ³n oficial y las recomendaciones de protecciÃ³n y riesgos en su propio idioma. TambiÃ©n apoyarÃ¡ la expediciÃ³n de nueva documentaciÃ³n para aquellos refugiados y solicitantes de asilo cuyos documentos se hayan perdido o hayan resultado daÃ±ados como consecuencia de las inundaciones, a fin de garantizar que sigan teniendo acceso a prestaciones sociales y servicios pÃºblicos. No obstante, la organizaciÃ³n asegurÃ³ que necesita al menos 3,21 millones de dÃ³lares para poder cubrir las necesidades mÃ¡s urgentes, incluyendo la ayuda econÃ³mica directa a las personas afectadas y el suministro de artÃ­culos de primera necesidad. Los fenÃ³menos meteorolÃ³gicos extremos en Brasil han sido frecuentes y mÃ¡s devastadores en los Ãºltimos aÃ±os, incluyendo sequÃ­as en la regiÃ³n amazÃ³nica y fuertes lluvias en estados del norte como BahÃ­a y Acre. En este sentido, la portavoz de la OrganizaciÃ³n MeteorolÃ³gica Mundial (OMM), Clare Nullis, destacÃ³ que esta meteorologÃ­a extrema se estÃ¡ viendo agravada en toda la regiÃ³n como consecuencia del impacto del fenÃ³meno meteorolÃ³gico de El NiÃ±o, pero tambiÃ©n a causa de los efectos del cambio climÃ¡tico. â€œHasta que dejemos de producir gases de efecto invernadero, que son los que estÃ¡n impulsando este clima extremo, vamos a ver mÃ¡s inundaciones extremas y una sequÃ­a mÃ¡s intensaâ€, asegurÃ³ la portavoz. ðŸ“§ ðŸ“¬ ðŸŒ Semana a semana tendremos un resumen de las noticias que nos harÃ¡n sentir que No es el fin del mundo.
